article_title: ACA insurance enrollment brisk in final days before deadline
article_text:
ACA insurance enrollment brisk in final days before deadline

Photo: Screenshot, HO Experts say consumers who buy insurance under the federal health...

Nearly a third of a million Texans have signed up for health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act's federal exchange, putting the state on pace to overtake last year at the deadline to ensure coverage on Jan. 1, U.S. Health and Human Services officials said on Wednesday.

article_metadata.description: Nearly a third of a million Texans have signed up for health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act's federal exchange, putting the state on pace to overtake last year at the deadline to ensure coverage on Jan. 1, U.S. Health and Human Services officials said on Wednesday.  "Texas is already about 80 percent of the way there," said Benjamin Wakana, Health and Human Services press secretary, of the roughly 370,000 who had signed up by Dec. 15 last year.  Nationally, more than 2.8 million had signed up as of Dec. 5, with a million new enrollees just last week, said Andy Slavitt, acting administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, during a phone-in briefing.
article_metadata.author.name: By Jenny Deam

Nationally, more than 2.8 million had signed up as of Dec. 5, with a million new enrollees just last week, said Andy Slavitt, acting administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, during a phone-in briefing.
